info.title: Teable App
info.description: Manage Data as easy as drink a cup of tea

operations.description: Retrieve a single record by its ID with options to specify field projections and output format.
Update a single record by its ID with support for field value typecast and record reordering.
Permanently delete a single record by its ID.
Create a copy of an existing record with optional custom positioning in the view.
Retrieve a list of records with support for filtering, sorting, grouping, and pagination. The response includes record data and optional group information.
Create one or multiple records with support for field value typecast and custom record ordering.
Update multiple records in a single request with support for field value typecast and record reordering.
Permanently delete multiple records by their IDs in a single request.

Permanently delete a base by baseId

Add a collaborator to a base
Permanently delete a space by spaceId
Create a integration to a space
Update a integration to a space
Get trash list for spaces or bases
Get trash items for base or table
Reset trash items for a base or table
restore a space, base, table, etc.
Retrieve the change history of a specific record, including field modifications and user information.
Retrieve the change history of all records in a table, including field modifications and user information.
Upload an attachment from a file or URL and append it to the cell
Retrieve the visibility and deletion status of a specific record.
Create a new field in the specified table with the given configuration
Retrieve a list of fields in a table with optional filtering
Permanently remove multiple fields from the specified table
Permanently remove a field from the specified table
Retrieve detailed information about a specific field by its ID
Update common properties of a field (name, description, dbFieldName). For other property changes, use the convert field API
Convert field to a different type with automatic type casting and symmetric field handling
Getting associated records for a view filter configuration.
Retrieve associated records that match the view filter configuration for a linked field

Get a view install plugin by id
Update the locked status of the view
Returns statistical aggregations of table data based on specified functions and grouping criteria
Returns the total number of rows in a view based on applied filters and criteria
Returns the distribution and count of records across different group points in the view
Returns records and count distribution across dates based on specified date range and fields
Returns the total count of records matching the specified search criteria and filters
Returns the indices and record IDs of records matching the search criteria
Create a new table in the specified base with customizable fields, views, and initial records. Default configurations will be applied if not specified.
Move a table to trash. The table can be restored within the retention period.
Retrieve detailed information about a specific table, including its schema, name, and configuration.
Retrieve a list of all tables in the specified base, including their basic information and configurations.
Permanently delete a table and all its data. This action cannot be undone.
Update the display name of a table. This will not affect the underlying database table name.
Update the emoji icon of a table. The icon must be a valid emoji character.
Update the display order of a table in the base. This affects the order in which tables are shown in the UI.
Update or remove the description of a table. Set to null to remove the description.
Update the physical database table name. Must be 1-63 characters, start with letter or underscore, contain only letters, numbers and underscore, and be unique within the base.
Retrieve the current user's permissions for a table, including access rights for table operations, views, records, and fields.
Get the activated index of a table
Retrieve a list of abnormal database indexes for a specific table by index type. This helps identify potential performance or maintenance issues.
Retrieve record and field identifiers based on the selected range coordinates in a table
Remove all content from the selected table range
Copy content from selected table ranges including headers if specified
Apply paste operation to insert content into the selected table range
Delete records or fields within the selected table range
Preview the results of a paste operation without applying changes to the table
Generate calculation plan for the field
Generate calculation plan for converting the field
Generate calculation plan for creating the field
Get user information via access token
Get row count for the share view

In a view with a field selector, link the records list of the associated field selector to get the. Linking the desired ones inside the share view should fetch the ones that have already been selected.

Get record comment counts by query
